item.title: Megan add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Megan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Megan add a quote by Charles de Gaulle
item.description: "How can you govern a country which has 246 varieties of cheese?" -- Charles de Gaulle

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "You can tell a lot about a fellow's character by his way of eating jellybeans. " -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Megan add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Megan add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead." -- Aristotle

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "I think it's perfectly possible to explain how the universe came about without bringing God into it, but I don't know everything, and there may well be a God somewhere, hiding away. Actually, if he is keeping out of sight, it's because he's ashamed of his followers and all the cruelty and ignorance they're responsible for promoting in his name. If I were him, I'd want nothing to do with them." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Megan add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Megan add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Megan add a quote by Gene Roddenberry
item.description: "Ancient astronauts didn't build the pyramids. Human beings built the pyramids, because they're clever and they work hard." -- Gene Roddenberry

item.title: Megan add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I have no special talents. I am only passionately curious." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Never memorize something that you can look up." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Black holes are where God divided by zero." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is at all comprehensible." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Megan add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Megan add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself." -- Plato

item.title: Megan add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Those who know, do. Those that understand, teach." -- Aristotle

item.title: Megan add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous." -- Aristotle

item.title: Megan add a quote by Harvard Lampoon
